trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract class for supporting formatting services to a line of text.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> class.
This constructor must be called for every class that is inherited from <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine>.
Gets the distance from the top to the baseline of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> object.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the baseline distance.
Create a collapsed line based on collapsed text properties.
A list of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextCollapsingProperties"></xref> objects that represent the collapsed text properties.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> value that represents a collapsed line that can be displayed.
Gets the number of characters following the last character of the line that may trigger reformatting of the current line.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of characters.
Releases all managed and unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter"></xref> object.
Renders the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> object based upon the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object onto which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref> is rendered.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> value that represents the drawing origin.
An enumerated <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.InvertAxes"></xref> value that indicates the inversion of the horizontal and vertical axes of the drawing surface.
Gets the distance from the top-most to bottom-most black pixel in a line.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the extent distance.
Gets the previous character hit after backspacing.
The current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object after backspacing.
Gets the character hit corresponding to the specified distance from the beginning of the line.
The text flow direction determines how the distance is measured.
A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the distance from the beginning of the line.
The object at the specified distance from the beginning of the line.
Gets the distance from the beginning of the line to the specified character hit.
The text flow direction determines how the distance is measured.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object whose distance you want to query.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the distance from the beginning of the line.
Gets an enumerator for enumerating <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.IndexedGlyphRun"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref>.
By enumerating through the list of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.IndexedGlyphRun> objects, the text layout client can obtain glyph information for each text source character.

An enumerator that allows you to enumerate each <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.IndexedGlyphRun"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine"></xref>.
Gets the next character hit for caret navigation.
The current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object.
The next <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object based on caret navigation.
Gets the previous character hit for caret navigation.
The current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object.
The previous <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterHit"></xref> object based on caret navigation.
Gets an array of bounding rectangles that represent the range of characters within a text line.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the index of first character of specified range.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of characters of the specified range.
A list of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextBounds"></xref> objects representing the bounding rectangle.
Gets a collection of collapsed text ranges after a line has been collapsed.
A list of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextCollapsedRange"></xref> objects that represent the collapsed text.
Gets the state of the line when broken by line breaking process.
The return value is `null` when the line ends at the end of the paragraph.

The text formatter client may pass the return value back as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter.FormatLine%2A> method, which allows the value to be used when formatting the next line within the same paragraph.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLineBreak"></xref> value that represents the line break.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextRun"></xref> objects in a text span that are contained within a line.
Gets a list of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextRun"></xref> objects contained within a text span.
Gets a value that indicates whether the line is collapsed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if the line is collapsed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether content of the line overflows the specified paragraph width.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, it the line overflows the specified paragraph width; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the height of a line of text.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line height.
Determines whether the text line is truncated in the middle of a word.

The IsTruncated property value is set only when the <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping> property of <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextParagraphProperties> is set to <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping>, and a single word is wider than the formatting paragraph width.

In such situation, <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextFormatter> truncates the line in the middle of the word to honor the desired behavior specified by <xref:System.Windows.TextWrapping> setting.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the text line is truncated in the middle of a word; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the total number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextSource"></xref> positions of the current line.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the total number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextSource"></xref> positions of the current line.
Gets the distance from the edge of the line's highest point to the baseline marker of the line.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the baseline distance of the marker.
Gets the height of a marker for a list item.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the height of the marker.
Gets the number of newline characters at the end of a line.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of newline characters.
Gets the distance that black pixels extend beyond the bottom alignment edge of a line.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang after distance.
Gets the distance that black pixels extend prior to the left leading alignment edge of the line.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang leading distance.
Gets the distance that black pixels extend following the right trailing alignment edge of the line.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the overhang trailing distance.
Get or sets the PixelsPerDip at which the text should be rendered.
The current PixelsPerDip value.
Gets the distance from the start of a paragraph to the starting point of a line.
A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the distance from the start of a paragraph to the starting point of a line.
Gets the distance from the top to the baseline of the line of text.
A <xref:System.Double> value that represents the text baseline distance.
Gets the height of the text and any other content in the line.
The TextHeight may differ from the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.TextLine.Height%2A> property if the client specified the line height.
A <xref:System.Double> value.
Gets the number of whitespace code points beyond the last non-blank character in a line.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the number of whitespace code points beyond the last non-blank character in a line.
Gets the width of a line of text, excluding trailing whitespace characters.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line width, excluding trailing whitespace characters.
Gets the width of a line of text, including trailing whitespace characters.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the text line width, including trailing whitespace characters.
